body: Tentatively slated for 5.5 M1 for _team discussion_

rename.from: Support user-supplied configuration to override the default `DisplayNameGenerator`
rename.to: Support global configuration to override the default DisplayNameGenerator

body:
Hello @marcphilipp @sbrannen

If this is up for grab, I can do this.

Let's use `junit.jupiter.displayname.generator.default` for the new config parameter.

@gopinath-langote Go for it! üôÇ

@marcphilipp 
Couple of clarification I want to do before starting PR

1. Configuration `junit.jupiter.displayname.generator.default` will be take `full class path` ex.
   `junit.jupiter.displayname.generator.default=org.junit.jupiter.api.DisplayNameGenerator.Standard`

2. Configuration ill go in `org.junit.jupiter.engine.config.JupiterConfiguration`

3. Both `CachingJupiterConfiguration` & `DefaultJupiterConfiguration` will implement this method of getting `DisplayNameGenerator`.

4. method signature will be something like
```
Class<?> getTestGeneratorClass();
```

5. `DisplayNameUtils` class will have logic for checking if a configuration exists for this.  



Please clarify my above assumption & then I will go straight for PR :) 


Regards,
Gopi

> 1. Configuration `junit.jupiter.displayname.generator.default` will be take `full class path` ex.
>   > `junit.jupiter.displayname.generator.default=org.junit.jupiter.api.DisplayNameGenerator.Standard`

Yes, the fully qualified class name. I'm wondering whether we should add a fallback so users can say `Standard` and we would first attempt to lookup that class and, in case that fails, try `org.junit.jupiter.api.DisplayNameGenerator.$className`. WDYT?

> 2. Configuration will go in `org.junit.jupiter.engine.config.JupiterConfiguration`

üëç 

> 3. Both `CachingJupiterConfiguration` & `DefaultJupiterConfiguration` will implement this method of getting `DisplayNameGenerator`.

üëç 

> 4. method signature will be something like
> ```
> Class<?> getTestGeneratorClass();
> ```

Let's use `getDefaultDisplayNameGeneratorClass()`.

> 5. `DisplayNameUtils` class will have logic for checking if a configuration exists for this.  

SGTM

@marcphilipp

1. If user don't provide configuration we are anyways going to use Standard.
I am not seeing someone who will put only Standard in configuration.
In case we are providing that, user might get confused with fully classname vs just name as Standard

-
Our documentation will be clear that if no configuration provided we will use Standard one.


that's what I think. 
Open for other opinion :)


2, 3 ,4 ,5 üëç

>     1. If user don't provide configuration we are anyways going to use Standard.
>        I am not seeing someone who will put only Standard in configuration.
>        In case we are providing that, user might get confused with fully classname vs just name as Standard

I think @marcphilipp was only using `Standard` as an example. We would of course not condone that one override the default with the default since that does not make sense.

But... a team may wish to set `ReplaceUnderscores` as the default generator. So following Marc's proposal, we could support `junit.jupiter.displayname.generator.default=org.junit.jupiter.api.DisplayNameGenerator.ReplaceUnderscores`
 or `junit.jupiter.displayname.generator.default=ReplaceUnderscores` as a convenience.

Though, to be honest, I'm not convinced that we need to support that since it may be more confusing than it's worth (especially for the status quo where there is only one implementation other than the default, `Standard`). Furthermore, I would like to leave open the possibility that Jupiter may later decide to implement generators that are not defined within the `DisplayNameGenerator` interface.

> Our documentation will be clear that if no configuration provided we will use Standard one.

Correct.
